title: Sylas' is so fucking overload who thought he was balanced in any way
body:
lets start with his passive  at level 1 we can be expecting it to do about 63 dmg if sylas picks up a dorans ring (tbh this is not this bad no because one is going to build him ad)
his Q does 54 dmg(with dorans) at level 1 slows you and has the potential to do that same dmg again with a slow that increased to 50% fucking 50%
his W is a dash that does  heals, and does extra dmg to other champs if there low health
his E if a dash that shields him (90% ap ratio on shield btw)  on his second cast he stuns then knocks them up
his ult is the worst at rank 3 he can use the ult he stole every 15 seconds (his knock up is 10 second cd so all you need is a yas ult and there a yas in almost every game)
it deals massive damage during laning phase and with his heal he is going to be sticking around way longer than you will
either way something need to be done about his overloaded kit the only way i can think of killing him reliable is cc him to death but thats about the solution with every other problematic champing if their not 1v9ing while flying around the map at the speed of light

> either way something need to be done about his overloaded kit the only way i can think of killing him reliable is cc him to death but thats about the solution with every other problematic champing if their not 1v9ing while flying around the map at the speed of light

There is not possible way to 1v9 unless you are fed like god, which is no longer problem of champ, but yours.

His laning phase is weak in almost every match up(mid and top, idk jng and bot). His teamfight potential isn't good either, unless you can steal some dope ult and then you have to wait 200% cd. He is nice duelist/split pusher with his sheen/passive and W outplay potential. 

So no, he is not op, nor overloaded, my prediction is his winrate won't go higher than 48-49% at best.

If he gets good ults to steal, he's very strong. If he doesn't get good ults to steal, he won't be nearly as strong. Unlike champs such as Ryze and Azir, this discrepancy isn't based on coordinated play vs solo queue; it's just how the ult works. Any given player could have two back-to-back Sylas matches with totally different power levels. It's definitively unbalanceable.

Right now, he is getting rolled.  My worry is that because of how bad people are doing with him, he gets a buff and then the real scary part of him comes out, when people get experienced with him.  Honestly, the dust needs to settle, but I also think that new champs like this should not be inserted into ranked games right away for this reason.  Once people learn to play him and vs then we will see what is really going on.  I do think he is overtooled and will be insane once people figure him out, but for right now I don't see it in most games.
